### Project Summary for VCS-PD Zambia Project 2 (2371)

#### Summary Description of the Technologies/Measures to be Implemented
The VCS-PD Zambia Project 2 aims to distribute and install approximately 500,000 fuel-efficient improved cookstoves (ICS) across households in Zambia. The chosen technology, the single pot TLC-CQC Rocket Stove, is designed to burn wood more efficiently, enhancing thermal transfer to cooking pots and thereby conserving fuel. This initiative is expected to mitigate deforestation, reduce indoor air pollution, and lessen the burden on women and children who traditionally spend significant time collecting firewood. The TLC-CQC Rocket Stove, constructed using 15 locally-produced bricks and incorporating metal components, optimizes combustion and heat transfer. To ensure the stoves' effectiveness and longevity, the project includes user registration, data logging, spot-checking, and periodic audits.

#### Location of the Project
The project is geographically situated within the Republic of Zambia, specifically at the coordinates 13°08'02.0"S latitude and 27°50'57.6"E longitude. This centralized location enables efficient distribution and monitoring of the cookstoves across the target households.

#### Explanation of GHG Emission Reductions or Carbon Dioxide Removals
The primary objective of the project is to achieve significant GHG emission reductions by replacing traditional, less efficient cookstoves with the fuel-efficient TLC-CQC Rocket Stove. By improving combustion efficiency and reducing fuel consumption for cooking and water heating, the project decreases the reliance on non-renewable biomass. This transition is anticipated to result in substantial reductions in greenhouse gas emissions over the project's duration.

#### Scenario Existing Prior to the Implementation of the Project
Before the implementation of this project, the target population predominantly relied on non-renewable wood fuel (firewood) to meet their cooking and heating needs. This practice contributed to higher levels of deforestation, indoor air pollution, and greenhouse gas emissions.

#### Estimate of Annual Average and Total Reductions and Removals
The project is projected to achieve an average annual reduction of 1,713,078 tonnes of CO2 equivalent (CO2e). Over the 10-year crediting period, the total estimated GHG emission reductions amount to 17,130,783 tonnes of CO2e. These figures underscore the project's potential to make a significant impact on mitigating climate change.

In summary, the VCS-PD Zambia Project 2 represents a comprehensive effort to improve household energy efficiency, enhance public health, and contribute to global carbon reduction goals through the widespread adoption of advanced cookstove technology.
